en-gb: Woman has been reported missing from her home
Officer sent to investigate and finds more information about the woman, and gets a recent photo
Photo uploaded to INSPEC2T app, a member of the public has informed local police she saw her on top of a bus stop
Officers locate the missing woman and take her to hospital for a checkup, she later returned home and is now safe
Officers search a larger area and eventually find the woman and return her to her home
Body has been found in a river and has been identified as the missing person
Reports of someone moving a wheelie bin
The 2 neighbours have started a verbal argument outside the property
Reported that one of the neighbours has assaulted the other outside the property
A man has been stabbed and is slumped next to the wheelie bin
Member of the public provides photographic evidence of man with a mechete using the INSPEC2T app
A citizen has informed the police that he saw which person assaulted the other
Issue dissolves itself and is no longer a problem
The officer has managed to stop the incident from developing, both neighbours have agreed to ignore the incident
The officer has calmed down the two neighbours and the verbal abuse stops
The officer manages to break up the fight and send the two neighbours on their way
Man has been left on the street until paramedics arrive, no arrests made, general public happiness decreases
Offender has been arrested by police after finding him in a shed nearby
Officers clean up and a man is arrested for the assault
Using citizen information, the officers manage to locate the man and arrest him
Report of a young female running through the city centre partially clothed and appears distressed.
Resolution due to delay in rape being reported vital evidence is lost no arrests made.
Officer eventually locates female who discloses that she has been raped.
Wait to start rape investigation leading to evidence being lost and although suspect arrested not enough evidence to secure a charge
Information allows officers to locate female quickly who discloses that she has been raped
Rape investigation conducted and offender identified and arrested
Report of a vehicle being park in an inconsiderate manner on a residential street.
Patrol attends and fines that vehicle is not causing an obstruction & cannot do anything refers the matter to council parking services.
Information allows dispatch to determine that the matter is not a police one & issue is referred to council parking services.
Public are asking for police to dispatch officers to the location
Information allows dispatch to determine that the matter is not a police one & issue is referred to council parking services. However due to the delay in resolving matter confidence is lost.
Report of a disabled female in a wheelchair being verbally abused by a young male in the street, there are no cctv cameras in the area.
Due to lack of deployment not enough evidence can be obtained to identify & prosecute the offender
Officer attends and take statement from victim and witnesses. Using information suspect is identified
Arrest the suspect, using victim & witness statements suspect is successfully prosecuted
Suspect eventually arrested and successfully prosecuted at the cost of public confidence
Information allows officers to quickly identify the suspect who is arrested a short distance away
Suspect is successfully prosecuted
Report of two homeless males fighting over a bottle of wine in the city centre.
Fight escalates resulting in one of the males smashing the bottle and stabbing the other.
Victim bleeds out & dies due to lack of deployment
Deploy officers, arrest the offender. Due to the severity of the injury a scene is identified and officers allocated to staff it awaiting CSI
Forensic evidence allows offender to be successfully prosecuted
Information allows officers to identify which of the males was the aggressor. Officer attends and arrests aggressor thus preventing situation escalating
Aggressor is successfully prosecuted
Officer attends and defuses the situation before it gets out of hand however unable to identify who was the aggressor. Both males warned and go their separate ways
Report from a drunk male stating that he has been assaulted inside a busy nightclub. Male refuses an ambulance as he is not seriously injured.
Drunk male becomes aggressive with doorstaff and tries picking a fight
Drunk male has started attacking a member of doorstaff
Deploy an officer, male is arrested for assault after attacking a member of doorstaff
Male is successfully prosecuted however still wants to report assault inside the club
Male reporting assault inside the club is unable to provide full information and no further arrests can be made
Deploy an officer male is arrested for drunk & disorderly however still wanting to report assault once sober in the morning
Due to drunken state male isnâ€™t able to provide full information and no arrests can be made
Drunk male becomes aggressive with officers which results in him being arrested disorderly however still wanting to report assault once sober in the morning
Information allows officers to identify a suspect and make an arrest
Suspect is successfully prosecuted
Report of a group of 10-15 youths gathering outside a fast food restaurant causing a nuisance
Officer attends resolves current problem but fails to address long term issues.
Information leads to finding identity of youths and reason for them causing problems
Officer attends, resolves current issue & long term issues.
Nuisance escalates into criminal damage leading to window being smashed.
Groups behaviour escalates further & staff member gets assaulted whilst challenging them
Offenders identified and arrested
Due to time taken key evidence is lost meaning arrests cannot be made
Report of an elderly male being found in a confused state by staff on the train station.
Officer attend and discovers that male has been reported missing
Officer returns male to family address & submits reports
Male is eventually returned home however becomes increasingly distressed during the wait and requires officer to spend additional time calming him down
Officer calms down the elderly man who was distressed
Information obtained identify man as a missing person
Report of a collision between two vehicles on a busy road, report states that no persons are injured.
Report resolved without police deployment. Slight lose of happiness.
Officer attends no offences have taken place advices both parties to exchange details. Report resolved
Report of a collision involving two vehicles on a busy road, report is unable to give a specific junction & states that one of the drivers is complaining of neck pain.
Delay in reporting causes problems with congestion leading to several incidents of road rage.
Officers attend & closes part of the road and take details. One of the drivers smells of alcohol.
Driver successfully charged with drink driving.
1 driver arrested at scene but wait until additional resources are available to transport into custody
Driver eventually transported to custody, due to delay in driver getting into custody alcohol level reduced and driver released without being charged
Report of a shoplifter being detained by security staff at a large retailer
Male becomes aggressive and runs away from security, assaulting them in the process
Male eventually arrested and prosecuted for theft and assault
Due to delay in deployment key evidence is lost & prosecution no longer possible
Information reveals that shoplifter has never been in trouble previously and can issued a fixed penalty for the theft. Report concluded
